snippet: The murder of Roberto Rodríguez in the Bronx appeared to be a drunken street brawl. But the closer the police looked, the more complicated the story grew....
abstract: Profile of Roberto Rodriguez, whose murder was seventh in 40th Precinct in South Bronx, which has seen total of 12 homicides already in 2016; Rodriguez was fatally stabbed by gang member Alberto Aquino-Simon after it was revealed that Rodriguez had witness Aquino-Simon stab a rival gang member and was willing to testify to it (Series: Murder in the 4-0).

byline.original: By JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr. and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sandra E. Garcia, Benjamin Mueller, Ashley Southall and Isvett Verde from New York, and Paulina Villegas from Tulancingo, Mexico. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The murder of Roberto Rodríguez in the Bronx appeared to be a drunken street brawl. But the closer the police looked, the more complicated the story grew.

headline.print_headline: Quest for New Life Ends in Tangle of Gang Ties
headline.main: Quest for a New Life Ends in a Tangle of Gang Ties
